alert.message: The hosts listed below have a memory usage rate of over 90%!
alert.name: Hosts Memory Usage (over time) Alert

panels.description: This report displays memory usage rates for all hosts in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
-- This report returns for all hosts in the data source
-- the cpu and memory usage rate over time.

-- Memory usage
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS host_name,
    MEM_Usage
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            samples.host_id,
            host_name,
            samples.history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( samples.memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                WHERE host_status = 1
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id = samples.host_id
                        AND delete_date ISNULL
                    )   
        WHERE
            samples.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts a
                        GROUP BY a.host_id
                    )
        GROUP BY samples.host_id, host_name, history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
ORDER BY sub_query.time, MEM_Usage DESC

panels.title: Hosts Memory Usage (over time)

alert.message: The hosts listed below have a CPU usage rate of over 90%!
alert.name: Hosts CPU Usage (over time) Alert

panels.description: This report displays CPU usage rates for all hosts in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
-- This report returns for all hosts in the data source
-- the cpu and memory usage rate over time.

-- CPU usage
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),

            samples.host_id,
            host_name,
            samples.history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( samples.cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                WHERE host_status = 1
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id = samples.host_id
                        AND delete_date ISNULL
                    )   
        WHERE
            samples.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest hosts configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts a
                        GROUP BY a.host_id
                    )
        GROUP BY samples.host_id, host_name, history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
ORDER BY sub_query.time, CPU_Usage DESC

panels.title: Hosts CPU Usage (over time)

alert.message: The hosts listed below have transmitted dropped packets!
alert.name: Hosts Ethernet Interface Tx Dropped Packets (over time) Alert

panels.description: Transmitted total dropped packets of all hosts interfaces in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
-- This query returns the Ethernet Interface 
-- Tx and Rx total dropped packets, over time.

SELECT DISTINCT
    time,
    CONCAT 
    (
        COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ' (', 
        COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ')'
    ) AS interface_host_name,
    AVG ( Tx_drop ) AS "Tx. Drop"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            CASE
                WHEN MAX (v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date) IS NULL
                    THEN MAX (host_name)
                ELSE MAX (host_name)
            ||
            '*'
            END AS host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmitted_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) AS Tx_drop
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, transmitted_dropped_total_packets 
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the time range
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT host_interface_id
                        FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts_interfaces
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, transmitted_dropped_total_packets
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        samples_hourly_daily.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active host only
                            samples_hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmitted_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name,
    host_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Hosts Ethernet Interface Tx Dropped Packets (over time)

alert.message: The hosts listed below have received dropped packets!
alert.name: Hosts Ethernet Interface Tx Dropped Packets (over time) Alert

panels.description: Received total dropped packets of all hosts interfaces in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
-- This query returns the Ethernet Interface 
-- Tx and Rx total dropped packets, over time.

SELECT DISTINCT
    time,
    CONCAT 
    (
        COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ' (', 
        COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ')'
    ) AS interface_host_name,
    AVG ( Rx_drop ) AS "Rx. Drop"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
                ELSE v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            CASE
                WHEN MAX (v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date) IS NULL
                    THEN MAX (host_name)
                ELSE MAX (host_name)
            ||
            '*'
            END AS host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( received_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) AS Rx_drop
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets 
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the time range
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT host_interface_id
                        FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts_interfaces
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        samples_hourly_daily.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active host only
                            samples_hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.received_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            host_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name,
    host_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Hosts Ethernet Interface Tx Dropped Packets (over time)

alert.message: The hosts listed below have a unplanned downtime rate of over 95%!
alert.name: Host Unplanned Downtime Alert

panels.description: This report displays the unplanned downtime for all hosts in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    $__time(history_datetime),
    COALESCE ( host_name, MAX ( host_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS host_name,
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN host_status = 3
                    THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( samples.minutes_in_status ) AS "Unplanned Downtime"
FROM 
    v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples AS samples
    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id = samples.host_id
                AND delete_date ISNULL
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                            GROUP BY host_id
                        )
            )
WHERE
    history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
GROUP BY history_datetime, host_name

panels.title: Host Unplanned Downtime

alert.message: The virtual machines listed below have a memory usage rate of over 98%!
alert.name: Virtual Machines Memory Usage (over time) Alert

panels.description: This report displays memory usage rates for all virtual machines in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
-- This report returns for all vms in the data source
-- the cpu and memory usage rate over time.

-- Memory usage
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    COALESCE ( vm_name, MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS vm_name,
    MEM_Usage
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            samples.vm_id,
            vm_name,
            samples.history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( samples.memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                WHERE vm_status = 1
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = samples.vm_id
                        AND delete_date ISNULL
                    )   
        WHERE
            samples.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_id
                    )
        GROUP BY samples.vm_id, vm_name, history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
ORDER BY sub_query.time, MEM_Usage DESC

panels.title: Virtual Machines Memory Usage (over time)

alert.name: Virtual Machines CPU Usage (over time) Alert

panels.description: This report displays CPU usage rates for all virtual machines in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
-- This report returns for all vms in the data source
-- the cpu and memory usage rate over time.

            SUM ( COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, vm_id, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                WHERE vm_status = 1
            ) AS samples
            INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms
                ON

            AND samples.history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest vms configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id

                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms a

    ) AS sub_query

panels.title: Virtual Machines CPU Usage (over time)

alert.message: The virtual machines listed below have transmitted dropped packets!
alert.name: Virtual Machines Ethernet Interface Tx Dropped Packets (over time) Alert

panels.description: Transmitted total dropped packets of all virtual machine interfaces in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
-- This query returns the VM Ethernet Interface 
-- Tx and Rx total dropped packets, over time.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    CONCAT
	  (
	      COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ' (', 
	      COALESCE ( vm_name, MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ')'
	  ) AS disk_and_vm_name,
    AVG ( Tx_drop ) AS "Tx. Drop"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                ELSE v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            CASE
                WHEN MAX (v4_4_configuration_history_vms.delete_date) IS NULL
                    THEN MAX (vm_name)
                ELSE MAX (vm_name)
            ||
            '*'
            END AS vm_name,
            history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmitted_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) AS Tx_drop
        FROM 
            (    
                SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, transmitted_dropped_total_packets
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                        statistics.vm_interface_id
                    )
		        INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
		            ON
		                (
					              v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.device_id =
						            statistics.vm_interface_id
						            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.type = 'interface'
					          )
		        INNER JOIN 
		        v4_4_configuration_history_vms
		            ON
		                (
					              v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = 
						            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id
					          )
        WHERE 
            -- Here we filter by the time range
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest vm interfaces configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_interface_id
                        FROM     
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, transmitted_dropped_total_packets
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_interface_id = 
                                        b.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS d
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        d.vm_configuration_version =
                                        c.vm_configuration_version
                                        AND d.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active vm only
                            d.vm_status = 1
                            AND c.vm_interface_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT device_id
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                        WHERE 
                                            create_date < $__timeTo()
                                            AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                            -- Here we get the latest vm devices configuration
                                            AND history_id 
                                                IN 
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices AS a
                                                        GROUP BY 
                                                            a.vm_id,
                                                            a.device_id
                                                    )
                                    )
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.vm_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmitted_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) 
                            DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            vm_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name,
    vm_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Virtual Machines Ethernet Interface Tx Dropped Packets (over time)

alert.message: The virtual machines listed below have received dropped packets!
alert.name: Virtual Machines Ethernet Interface Rx Dropped Packets (over time) Alert

panels.description: Received total dropped packets of all virtual machine interfaces in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
-- This query returns the VM Ethernet Interface 
-- Tx and Rx total dropped packets, over time.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(all_sub_queries.time),
    CONCAT
	  (
	      COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ' (', 
	      COALESCE ( vm_name, MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) || ')'
	  ) AS disk_and_vm_name,
    AVG ( Rx_drop ) AS "Rx. Drop"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            CASE
                WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.delete_date IS NULL
                    THEN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
                ELSE v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_name
            ||
            '*'
            END AS interface_name,
            CASE
                WHEN MAX (v4_4_configuration_history_vms.delete_date) IS NULL
                    THEN MAX (vm_name)
                ELSE MAX (vm_name)
            ||
            '*'
            END AS vm_name,
            history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( received_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) ) AS Rx_drop
        FROM 
            (    
                SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id =
                        statistics.vm_interface_id
                    )
		        INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
		            ON
		                (
					              v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.device_id =
						            statistics.vm_interface_id
						            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.type = 'interface'
					          )
		        INNER JOIN 
		        v4_4_configuration_history_vms
		            ON
		                (
					              v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = 
						            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices.vm_id
					          )
        WHERE 
            -- Here we filter by the time range
            history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest vm interfaces configuration
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.vm_interface_id
                        FROM     
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_interface_id, received_dropped_total_packets
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS c
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        c.vm_interface_id = 
                                        b.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, vm_configuration_version, vm_status
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS d
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        d.vm_configuration_version =
                                        c.vm_configuration_version
                                        AND d.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active vm only
                            d.vm_status = 1
                            AND c.vm_interface_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT device_id
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices
                                        WHERE 
                                            create_date < $__timeTo()
                                            AND ( delete_date > $__timeFrom() OR delete_date IS NULL )
                                            -- Here we get the latest vm devices configuration
                                            AND history_id 
                                                IN 
                                                    (
                                                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_devices AS a
                                                        GROUP BY 
                                                            a.vm_id,
                                                            a.device_id
                                                    )
                                    )
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.vm_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.vm_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                            AVG ( COALESCE ( b.received_dropped_total_packets, 0 ) )
                            DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_vms_interfaces.vm_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            vm_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name,
    vm_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Virtual Machines Ethernet Interface Rx Dropped Packets (over time)

alert.message: The virtual machines listed below have a unplanned downtime rate of over 99%!
alert.name: Virtual Machines Unplanned Downtime Alert

panels.description: This report displays the unplanned downtime for all virtual machines in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    $__time(history_datetime),
    COALESCE ( vm_name, MAX ( vm_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS vm_name,
    SUM 
        (
            CASE
                WHEN vm_status = 3
                    THEN COALESCE ( samples.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                ELSE 0
            END
        ) / SUM ( samples.minutes_in_status ) AS "Unplanned Downtime"
FROM 
    v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS samples
    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_vms
        ON 
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.vm_id = samples.vm_id
                AND delete_date ISNULL
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_vms
                            GROUP BY vm_id
                        )
            )
WHERE
    history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
GROUP BY history_datetime, vm_name

panels.title: Virtual Machines Unplanned Downtime

alert.message: The storage domains listed below have a disk usage rate of over 85%!
alert.name: Storage Domains Disk Usage (over time) Alert

panels.description: This report displays the disk usage rate for all storage domains in the data source.

targets.rawSql:
-- This query returns for a storage domain
-- the disk usage rate per minute.

SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.history_datetime),
    COALESCE 
        (
            storage_domain_name,
            MAX ( storage_domain_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ),
            ''
        ) AS storage_domain_name,
    used_disk_size / (available_disk_size+used_disk_size) AS disk_usage
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            v4_4_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime,
            AVG ( available_disk_size_gb ) AS available_disk_size,
            AVG (used_disk_size_gb) AS used_disk_size
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, available_disk_size_gb, storage_domain_id, used_disk_size_gb
                FROM v4_4_statistics_storage_domains_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS samples,
            v4_4_configuration_history_storage_domains
        WHERE
            -- Here we join the storage domain configurations table with the statistics table
            v4_4_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_id =
            samples.storage_domain_id
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            -- Here we get the latest storage domain configurations
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_storage_domains.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_storage_domains a
                        GROUP BY a.storage_domain_id
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_storage_domains.storage_domain_name,
            history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
ORDER BY sub_query.history_datetime, disk_usage DESC

panels.title: Storage Domains Disk Usage (over time)
